file_content.text: This business isn't for you, stranger.
There's nothing we can do for you now.
We've already told you about the Evocii. See if you can find her before the Cyclone kills her.
You have the Cyclone. I hope it satisfies you.
That's enough. I think that's enough. We should talk.
My brother's right. There's no reason to keep fighting. No reason at all.
You came here for something. You want something. Whatever it is, name it--and we'll give it to you.
What do you know about the Cyclone serum?
Let's discuss Cyclone.
Cyclone is a genetic modification solution... very expensive, very little left. Maybe a corporate experiment--I don't know. We don't ask.
Take what we have--it's yours. Take it and get out.
Give me everything you've got. I'll sort through it myself.
Just hand it all over.
Ah. Yes. The serums and the stimulants are all good, all of it useful.
I don't need you for anything. I could shoot you right now.
Why shouldn't I kill you?
If you kill us and walk out, people will want to know why.
Our clients will ask questions. Everyone will ask questions. You don't want people asking questions about you--not on Nar Shaddaa.
Let us live, and it's just another fight in the slums. We'll pay you for protection and give you what you want!
Hand over a dose of Cyclone. Get moving.
I need the serum.
We don't--there's very little remaining. But you can take what's left. You're welcome to it.
Hand over your medical serums, gene-stims... everything you've got.
Let me see your supplies.
Ah--yes. Yes, they're yours. Enough to last you a long while.
Get up against the wall. I need to search this place.
Shut up while I work.
Ah. Yes. If that's what you like. We won't interfere--you can have the supplies....
We're finished, then. You're satisfied? You can leave our place of business now.
Don't test me.
For what it's worth, I meant this to go down differently.
Sorry about this.
Yes. We have learned a valuable lesson about how to deal with new clients.
We will not interfere with your ventures. Please go now.
I'll go. After I give you something to remember me by.
One last thing... [Hurt her]
Ah! Curse you. May you suffocate for this!
My sister forgets her place, stranger. We won't trouble you--please be on your way....
You will not survive this--no, you will not.
Who's this stranger coming into our shop? Do you know, sister?
I don't know, brother. She handles herself well--but she's not one of our usual clients.
She smells hurt. Her genes are unraveling. Her bones are breaking. She's had bad augmentations--but we can fix that.
She smells healthy. Clean. Like someone too good for augmentation. Someone who keeps her bones straight and her genes pure.
I don't know, brother. He's pretty, for his species--but he's not one of our usual clients.
He smells hurt. His genes are unraveling. His bones are breaking. He's had bad augmentations--but we can fix that.
We can definitely fix that. Is that why you've come, stranger? Do you need stimulants? Cybernetics? Genetic modification? Tell us.
I want to know who I'm dealing with, first.
Who are you?
My name is Ekayn, and my sister is Sabaya. We take care of this business. We've been here a long time.
We obtain augmentations for the needy. For people who need to fight to survive.
I hear there's a new serum going around. Cyclone. You know about it?
Tell me about Cyclone.
You've been keeping up with the technology, haven't you?
I'm hurting. Please--I need something that'll let me fight.
Please, fix me up.
Poor creature. Probably a brave killer before her augmentations degraded. Now she needs improvement, fine-tuning.
Poor, pretty creature. Probably a brave killer before his augmentations degraded. Now he needs a gentle touch, fine-tuning.
We can help clients like you. Look around--see how strong everyone is? You can trust our work.
Told you this was the place. You can trust them.
I think you need one of our serums. Something to smooth out those ugly gene sequences and make you dangerous again.
I've heard Cyclone is strong.
Cyclone, maybe?
You heard right. Cyclone is very strong--but it has drawbacks.
Whatever it takes--I'll pay to be faster, stronger.
Anything, please!
We may have something for you. We have cortical stimulants and BX-13 medical bacteria.
It can be lethal, but if you want to be very quick, Cyclone is worth a look.
I'm interested.
That's very good.
I don't know... I've had bad experiences. Can't those serums kill you?
I'm not sure about this.
Not ordinarily. There are some, I suppose... still, very few are fatal.
You've heard the rumors about Cyclone, perhaps? They're true, but you don't have to worry.
Cyclone causes permanent damage--it's very effective if you don't plan on coming back from a job. Not for you, I think?
Actually... it's just what I'm looking for.
Cyclone sounds appealing.
Is it? That's very good.
Maybe you could give me just one dose. No charge?
I'd like a sample.
That isn't how we usually operate, especially with a serum as lethal as Cyclone.
But... you aren't planning on using it yourself, are you? Not yet, anyway.
You have experience. You can go through many more augmentations with our help.
Take the Cyclone. Keep it in reserve, or try it on a friend. We'll be here when you're ready to buy for real.
Next time I need an augmentation, I know where I'll come.
I'll remember you.
We very much hope so.
Much obliged.
As you should.
How do you get Cyclone, anyway? Who makes it?
Where's it from?
We don't know. We prefer not to ask those questions. Our doses came through a middleman, not from the manufacturer.
Probably a corporate product. But once the maker is done testing, you can bet Cyclone won't be available to ordinary beings like us.
Unfortunately, we have none available.
Many desire to purchase Cyclone, and our supplies are reserved for... preferred customers. Just yesterday, one female spent everything she had for a dose.
I have the money. Don't disappoint me.
I'll pay whatever it costs.
Oh, I promise we won't. Sister?
This is our last dose of Cyclone. I hope it does what you need--and I hope it kills you beautifully.
I have other plans. I'm not injecting myself with toxins.
It's not for me.
No? I won't ask how you plan to use it, then. I'll just say "good luck."
Thanks.
And with you.
I'll let you... things get back to your business.
Whatever you say, freak.
So rude. Still, you're welcome back, if you need other augmentations. Provided you survive the Cyclone.
Goodbye, creature. We wish you well.
Goodbye, pretty man. We'll miss you.
Any chance I could meet this client?
Can I talk to her?
Poor thing. You really are desperate, aren't you? I think we can afford to help.
The Evocii who came in yesterday to buy Cyclone... she wanted to strike against the slaver gangs. Die gloriously for her people.
I don't know exactly where she's gone, but maybe you can find her still fighting. Maybe you can find her corpse.
Thanks.
Maybe you'll come back when you're ready for some augmentation. If you don't want Cyclone, then something else.
Maybe I'll be in time to save her life.
I could rescue her.
I wouldn't get my hopes up.
If that's all you can tell me, then I've got work to do.
We're finished.
So rude. Barely worth our time at all.
Don't worry, brother. You feel her health... the girl will be lucky to survive another week.
Goodbye, my new friend. Good luck finding the Evocii.
Don't worry, brother. You feel his health... the pretty man will be lucky to survive another week.
Goodbye, pretty man. Good luck finding the Evocii.
Be careful on your way out of the shop--and don't bother the other clients.
You'll give me the dose for free--or I introduce you to my blaster.
A threat? I had high hopes for you. I thought you might be a fine client. But I was wrong.
We have other clients, though. Clients who will protect us and guard us. They'll see to you now.
He smells healthy. Clean. Like someone too good for augmentation. Someone who keeps his bones straight and his genes pure.
Is that right? What brings you here, stranger? Why come into our little dealership if you're not interested in augmentations?
There must be some mistake. I'd love to know what you have to offer.
But I am interested!
Of course you do. Who doesn't, really?
The problem is, we think you're interested for the wrong reasons. Don't we, brother?
You read my mind, sister.
Introduce yourselves, and we can talk.
Who are you?
I'm Sabaya. My brother is Ekayn. We own this little place and try to keep our business safe.
And I don't think you're here to do business. I don't think you're here for anything we'd condone.
I'm in charge now, freak.
I understand. Slave raiding in the slums, is that right?
Too bad we can't make room for slavers. This is a place of business.
Everyone, show this stranger what we do to people who come in for the wrong reasons....
We're not selling anything right now--later, maybe?
I don't have that kind of money.
I can't afford NUMBER credits.
Most of us in the business have sold out already. So unless you plan to steal from another buyer....
Mm. We could help you with that.
We made our position clear. We are not selling you Cyclone.
Hush, brother. There's no need to be rude.
For a pittance, we can point you to our last client. You may negotiate between yourselves.
I've got the money--now how do I find her?
Here you go.
I don't like this, but I know when I'm cornered. Here.
Not much choice...
Excellent. See, brother? There are always ways.
If you're going to ask for that kind of money, I may as well pay for the serum.
I'll buy the Cyclone instead.
Excellent reasoning.
I'm out of patience!
You're joking. I've killed for less than that--and I'm not always cheap.
Cyclone, maybe?
It's a deal.
Hand it over. Now.
Give me the serum or else.
